result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas R. Wayman

defendant.name: Wayman, Thomas R.
defendant.address: 202 Makoons Trail PO Box 1230, Lac du Flambeau, WI 54538

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Not to possess prescription drugs without a prescription, Not to possess drug paraphernalia,  Make an appointed for AODA counseling within 24 hours of release from the Vilas County Jail and comply with all AODA assessments and counseling.

1:20 PM Defendant Thomas R. Wayman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jolin appears by video.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State to e-file information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives formal reading of information.  Not guilty pleas entered by court.  Bond continued.

1:20 PM Defendant Thomas R. Wayman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jolin appears by video.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant and Defense confirm receipt of complaint.  Charges read. State speaks to the incident.  Parties speak to bond.  Court sets bond at $750.00 Cash: Not to possess prescription drugs without a prescription, Not to possess drug paraphernalia,  Make an appointed for AODA counseling within 24 hours of release from the Vilas County Jail and comply with all AODA assessments and counseling.  Bond form.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
